intro: Festuca rubra var. mediana, commonly known as red fescue, is a cool-season grass species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its fine, dark green blades and dense growth habit, making it suitable for lawns and erosion control. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and has a clumping growth pattern. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-gray hue, especially when mature. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, preferring full sun to partial shade.
